abstract: Dan Barry essay reflects on decision by new owners of Pawtucket Red Sox to move team to Providence, RI; observes that town's beloved McCoy Stadium will now go the way of its mills, which faded amid decline of industry in the mid 20th century; questions whether investors truly understand how devastating move will be for town and its traditions.
lead_paragraph: By announcing they intended to abandon Pawtucket, R.I., the new owners of the Red Sox’ Class AAA team reminded fans that beyond baseball’s innate poetry, it is a cold business.

headline.main: A City Braces for Its Ballpark to Go the Way of Its Mills
headline.seo: Through Years of Change, Pawtucket, R.I., Always Had McCoy Stadium
headline.print_headline: A City Braces for Its Ballpark to Go the Way of Its Mills

snippet: By announcing they intended to abandon Pawtucket, R.I., the new owners of the Red Sox’ Class AAA team reminded fans that beyond baseball’s innate poetry, it is a cold business.
